['Bearable - able to be endured or tolerated.', 'Acceptable - meeting a standard of acceptability; satisfactory.', 'Permissible - permitted within certain limits or under certain conditions.', 'Endurable - capable of being borne without serious damage, distress, or harm.', 'Manageable - able to be dealt with successfully or controllably.', 'Satisfactory - good enough; meets the required standards.', 'Reasonable - fair and sensible in terms of expectations or requests.', 'Livable - adequate for living, especially when referring to conditions like housing or climate.', 'Forgivable - excusable; able to be forgiven despite faults or mistakes.', 'Moderate - average in amount, intensity, quality, etc.; not extreme or excessive.', 'Passable - just adequate enough to pass a test of acceptability.', 'Middling - ordinary; neither bad nor good but lacking distinction and excellence.', 'Respectable - conforming to accepted standards within society, especially regarding moral values or quality.', 'Sufficient - enough in amount or quantity to meet a particular purpose or need.', 'Decent - adequate; satisfactory in terms of standard or quality.', 'Adequate - sufficient for some requirement or purpose.', 'Satisfied (in contexts where it implies tolerance) - having enough or meeting the needs, desires, etc., without being overly satisfied to be considered excellent.', 'Mere - used before a noun in order to minimize its importance or imply that there is more than what is stated.', 'Workable - capable of being worked on; practicable.', 'Justifiable - able to be shown or proven to be just, rightful, or defensible (can be related to tolerable circumstances).']
